recordTypes.name: WPA Form 8A - Request for Certificate of Compliance
recordTypes.description:
Requests for Certificates of Compliance should be directed to the issuing authority that issued the final
Order of Conditions (OOC). If the project received an OOC from the Conservation Commission, submit
this request to that Commission. If the project was issued a Superseding Order of Conditions or was the
subject of an Adjudicatory Hearing Final Decision, submit this request to the appropriate DEP Regional
Office (see http://www.mass.gov/eea/agencies/massdep/about/contacts/find-the-massdep-regional-office-
for-your-city-or-town.html).

recordTypes.name: Auto Dealer - Class I, II, III License
One-Day Alcohol License
recordTypes.description:
To ensure sufficient planning timeline, it is highly recommended to apply at least 30-days prior to an event.

Please note that the approving body, Select Board, meets on a bi-weekly basis.

A nonprofit* organization may apply for either a one-day all-alcohol license or one-day beer and/or wine
license. 

A for profit** organization may apply for a one-day beer and/or wine license ONLY. Special license holders CANNOT purchase alcoholic beverages from a package store; alcoholic beverages must be purchased
from a State licensed supplier: https://www.mass.gov/service-details/apply-for-a-special-license-or-permitabcc

recordTypes.name: Natick Center Business Parking Permit
recordTypes.description:
Parking Permits allow you to park in areas designated “Parking by Permit Only" in the designated green areas.

The parking map and information can be found here:  https://www.natickma.gov/2154/Parking-Driving

recordTypes.name: Meeting Room Request Application
recordTypes.description:
The Morse Institute Library offers the use of its meeting rooms to further its roles as a place to meet and interact in meaningful ways, to learn and stay informed, and to celebrate and enjoy the diversity of the community. The Library's meeting rooms are a community asset, and use by community groups is encouraged when not in use for library purposes.

You can use this form to reserve the Lebowitz Meeting Hall and Community Room. 

Payment is due the FRIDAY before the meeting reservation.

recordTypes.name: Dog - Kennel License
recordTypes.description:
The Town of Natick is pleased to offer residents, businesses, and the public an electronic kennel licensing process through the Natick OpenGov portal. 

New Users: To use the Natick OpenGov Portal, new users must first register and create an account.
Returning Users: Use your previously created username and password.
*Note: If you have an existing OpenGov account with another community, your username and password are the same

About Natick Dog Kennel Licensing
All commercial or residential dog kennels are required to have a current Dog Kennel License to operate.

Dog Kennel Licenses must be renewed annually; failure to do so may result in fines of $500, per Article 50, §16.7 of the Town of Natick Charter and Bylaws and MGL Ch. 140, §141.

Kennel Licenses are valid January 1 through December 31 of each year.

The deadline for purchasing existing Dog Kennels without penalty is March 1. New Dog Kennel Licenses shall be obtained before the opening of the Dog Kennel. 

Purchased Dog Kennel Licenses are non-refundable.

Dog Kennel Licenses are not transferable.

If there are any questions, please contact

Animal Control Officer, (508) 647-9500

City Clerk's Office, (508) 647-6430

recordTypes.name: Community Preservation Act (CPA) - Letter of Interest ("LOI")
recordTypes.description:
The Letter of Intent (LOI) serves as guidance for individuals or CPA Project Proposal Teams as they prepare a CPA Project Proposal for consideration of Community Preservation Funding. At this stage of development, CPA Project Proposals can range from initial concepts to more formalized, scoped projects. The LOI Review Team, made up of Town Staff, will assist CPA Project Proposal Teams in refining their proposals.

After the LOI process, the next step is the CPA Funding Request Application. An LOI Letter is required before a CPA Funding Request Application may be submitted.

LOI Filings are accepted on a rolling basis

recordTypes.name: Contractor License
recordTypes.description: Licenses are required for contractors when doing any work including, paving, excavation or concrete.

recordTypes.name: Flammable Storage
recordTypes.description: Includes Black Powder Storage.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Establishment
recordTypes.description: Body Art Establishment locations are allowed in specific zones of the town. Verify your proposed location with the Zoning Officer at 508-647-6450 prior to making application.

recordTypes.name: Community Preservation Act (CPA) - CPA Funding Request Application
recordTypes.description: The CPA Funding Request Application commences after the LOI process and is the submittal of a formalized CPA Project Proposal that is ready to receive Community Preservation Funds. Review of CPA Project Proposals at this phase of review is conducted by the CPC. The review includes evaluation, ranking, and a vote whether to recommend a CPA Project Proposal to Town Meeting for allocation of Community Preservation Funds.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description:
Special permit, Variance, Section 6 Finding and Comprehensive Permit.

The CED staff will review your application for completeness shortly after the due date.  We will reach out to you through the portal if anything else is required or we need clarification. 

The CED staff will obtain the Determination Letter/Denial Letter from the Building Commissioner and all the required Town Staff comment letters for the ZBA application.

recordTypes.name: Planning Board - Dog Kennel Special Permit
recordTypes.description:
Dog Kennels (Home Occupation Dog Kennels, Personal Dog Kennels, Commercial Boarding and Training Dog Kennels, and Commercial Breeder Dog Kennels), which have five or more dogs are required to obtain a special permit from the Planning Board prior to opening/operating a Dog Kennel in Natick. 

Please use this Special Permit Application for Dog Kennels with 5 or more dogs.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU) Application Review
recordTypes.description:
Natick and Accessory Dwelling Units (ADU)

As Natick prepares for the 2024 Fall Annual Town Meeting (2024 FATM), Governor Healey signed into law the Affordable Homes Act on August 6, 2024.  As part of the Affordable Homes Act, Communities are required to allow for the creation of Accessory Dwelling Units (ADU) As of Right (also referred to as By-right). The Town of Natick at the 2024 Fall Annual Town Meeting voted to adopt Section III-M Accessory Dwelling Units, which regulates how ADUs are created in Natick.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is used for new construction, renovations, alterations, partial and interior demolition and major repairs to existing buildings including commercial, and one and two family buildings.

Two family dwellings require TWO building permits (one for each side).

All applications MUST be in the name of the CSL.

All uploaded documents MUST be in a PDF format. 

Please call the main office (508-647-6450) between the hours of 8am-4:30pm Monday through Wednesday, 8am-6pm Thursdays, and 8am to 12:30pm Fridays to schedule your building inspection. 

The applicant MUST be the CSL.   The job card MUST be on site at all times.

recordTypes.name: Food - Cottage Operation/Residential Kitchen
recordTypes.description:
Massachusetts State Sanitary Code Chapter X - Minimum Sanitation Standards for Food Establishments 105 CMR 590.010 (E) requires a Food Establishment Permit must be obtained if food is prepared in or distributed or sold from a Cottage Food/Residential Kitchen Operation.
Only foods that DO NOT require refrigeration and/or a variance shall be prepared in or distributed from a Cottage Operation/Residential Kitchen can be for sale to the public.
Wholesale Operations (selling to retail stores, restaurants etc.) require a food processor license be obtained from the State of MA Food Protection Program (FPP). Contact the State FPP at 617- 983-6770 or visit: https://www.mass.gov/guides/starting-a-wholesale-food-business
The use of brokers, wholesalers and warehouse by cottage kitchen operators to store, sell and distribute foods prepared in cottage (residential) kitchens is prohibited. Food products made in cottage kitchens may not be sold-out-of state (FDA does not recognize these foods as originating from an approved source).

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Applicant must be a licensed professional. 

This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc. 

The State requires that licensed electricians call the electrical inspector in order to schedule Inspections. Please call the main office (508-647-6450) between the hours of 8am-9am Monday through Friday and ask for the electrical inspector to schedule your inspections.   PLEASE HAVE YOUR PERMIT NUMBER HANDY! 

Inspections are typically scheduled the same or the following day. 

The job card MUST be on site at all times.

recordTypes.name: Gas Permit
recordTypes.description:
Applicant must be a licensed professional. 

This permit is required when gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances.

State requires that licensed plumbers call the gas inspector in order to schedule Inspections. Please call the main office (508-647-6450) between the hours of 8am-9am Monday through Friday and ask for the gas inspector to schedule your inspections. Inspections are typically scheduled the same or the following day.  PLEASE HAVE YOUR PERMIT NUMBER HANDY! 

The job card MUST be on site at all times.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description:
Applicant must be a licensed professional. 

A permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.

State requires that licensed plumbers call the plumbing inspector in order to schedule Inspections. Please call the main office (508-647-6450) between the hours of 8am-9am Monday through Friday and ask for the plumbing inspector to schedule your inspections. Inspections are typically scheduled the same or the following day. PLEASE HAVE YOUR PERMIT NUMBER HANDY! 

The job card MUST be on site at all times.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Sheet Metal
recordTypes.description:
This permit is required when a sheet metal worker is manufacturing, fabricating, assembling, handling, erecting, installing, dismantling, heat pumps,  alteration and/or repairing duct work, commercial hood vents and kitchen hoods.  

The job card MUST be on site at all times.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Plan Review
recordTypes.description:
Commercial Plan Review
Any work requiring permitting from 780 CMR and/or the IBC that includes:

1. New or substantially altered fire alarm systems
  a. Relocation of devices that involve egress changes or the addition of walls that will require additional devices
  b. Changes in the sequence of operation
2. New or substantially modified (relocation of 20 or more sprinklers) sprinkler systems
3. Overhead gas station suppression
4. Custom-engineered hood suppression systems
5. Or other complex fire protection systems
6. If egresses are impacted in any manner, then a plan to overcome the impairment shall be submitted as part of the package and reviewed by a third party.

The Fire Department review and approval are for work involving any of the following:

- 780 CMR Chapter 4 (Special Detailed Requirements Based on Use and Occupancy)
- Chapter 9 (Fire Protection Systems) 
- Chapter 34 (Existing Structures). 

An IEBC study shall be included in the submittal.

Should the plans fit into any of the above categories, they shall be reviewed by an approved party firm from the list below. The cost for review will be borne by the submitting firm (per 527 CMR 1.00, Section 1.15.1.3). The cost is set by the reviewing firm.

Third Party Reviewers

This list is in no particular order.

Code Red Consultants, LLC
CRCFIRE.com
thirdparty@crcfire.com
All emailed inquires and documentation will receive a response within 24 hours
\t
Jensen Hughes
jensenhughes.com
Carson Cook, PE
Email: carson.cook@jensenhughes.com
One Research Drive, Suite 305C,
Westborough, MA 01581
Office: 508-273-8490
Cell: 617-966-0128
\t
JS Consulting Engineers, PLLC
jsfirecode.com
Alex Browning, PE
Email: abrowning@jsfirecode.com
224 Main Street, Suite 2C,
Salem, NH 03079
Cell: 401-965-1157

Submittal Requirements

Submittals must be in accordance with the language below and be found to be satisfactory to the reviewing party. Incomplete submittals are subject to rejection and delays in permitting.

Prior to approval of a Building Permit by the Natick Building Department, Natick Fire Prevention requires Third Party Review and Recommendation for Approval of Tier One Construction Documents (including Engineering Plans, System Narratives, etc.) associated with new or modified fire protection/fire alarm systems. In addition to the life safety system approvals, a Construction Fire Safety Plan in accordance with NFPA 241 and 527 CMR 1.00 shall be reviewed.

categories.name: Community Preservation Committee (CPC)
categories.content:
Natick, a Community Preservation Act (“CPA”) community is committed to the use of Community Preservation Funds for Open Space Protection, Outdoor Recreation, Community (Affordable) Housing, and Historic Preservation (collectively “CPA Category Areas”). 

Letters of Interest ("LOI") and CPA Funding Request Applications are now being accepted

categories.name: Conservation Commission
Department of Public Works (DPW)
categories.content:
The last day for Street Openings and Driveways to be completed in the Town of Natick for this year will be on Thursday November 13, 2025. The last day to submit permits for the year will be by the end of the day on Monday November 3, 2025. 

Any questions, contact the Engineering Division at 1-508-647-6551.

categories.name: Planning Board
categories.content:
Apply Online to the Planning Board

Community Economic Development (CED), invites Applicants to submit applications for review through the Town’s online portal. The online portal intends to increase permitting efficiency, reduce paper, increase communication between Applicants and the Town while setting clear expectations for Application submittals.

At any time, if there are any questions, please get in touch with the Department of CED (508)647-6450.

categories.name: Zoning Board of Appeals
categories.content:
The Zoning Board of Appeals, also known as the ZBA, is a quasi-judicial board comprised of five regular members and three associate members. Applications reviewed by the ZBA, found within this portal, include appeals of a Building Commissioner determination, special permits, and variance applications subject to MGL c 40A.

2025 Meeting Schedul
